Race.SpecificTitle: Garden District Security District -- 19 Mills - CC - 8 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Garden District Security District Proposition

Summary:  Renewal of a special annual millage in an amount not to exceed nineteen mills for eight (8) years on all taxable real property in the Garden District Security District to promote and encourage security and the overall betterment of the Garden District Security District.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans levy a special annual ad valorem tax (except that no tax shall be imposed upon any parcel whose owner qualifies under the Louisiana Special Assessment Level pursuant to Article VII, Section 18(G)(1) of the Constitution of Louisiana), subject to the Homestead Exemption, to be called the Garden District Security District Tax, on taxable property situated within the boundaries of the Garden District Security District (which District is comprised of that area of the city of New Orleans within and including the following perimeter street and avenues: including both sides of Carondelet Street, Jackson Avenue, Magazine and Louisiana; and, Resolution R-09-618 City Council of New Orleans in an amount not to exceed nineteen (19) mills annually for eight (8) years, beginning in 2011 and ending in 2018, to be used solely and exclusively to promote and encourage security in the Garden District Security District as determined and managed by the Board of Commissioners of the Garden District Security District which additional security shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the District by the New Orleans Police Department?

Race.SpecificTitle: Lake Terrace Crime Prevention Dist. -- Parcel Fee - CC - 8 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Lake Terrace Crime Prevention District Proposition

Summary:  Renewal of a special annual fee in the amount of three hundred dollars ($300) for parcels with single family and seven hundred dollars ($700) for parcels with three (3) or more family units for eight (8) years on all taxable real property in the Lake Terrace Crime Prevention District for promoting security and the overall betterment of the Lake Terrace Crime Prevention District.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans levy a special annual ad valorem tax (except that no tax shall be imposed upon any parcel whose owner qualifies under the Louisiana Special Assessment Level pursuant to Article VII, Section 18(G)(1) of the Constitution of Louisiana), subject to the Homestead Exemption, to be called the Lake Terrace Crime Prevention District Tax, on taxable property situated within the boundaries of the Lake Terrace Crime Prevention District (which District is comprised of that area of the city of New Orleans within and including the following perimeter street and avenues: the centerlines of Robert E. Lee Boulevard and St. Bernard Avenue, the shoreline of Lake Pontchartrain and the centerlines of Lakeshore Drive and Pratt Drive as specified by Resolution R-09-615 of the City Council of New Orleans in an amount not to exceed three hundred dollars ($300) on each improved parcel of land located within Lake Terrace Crime Prevention District except that the fee shall be seven hundred dollars ($700) on each improved parcel of land with three (3) or more family units annually for eight (8) years beginning in 2011 and ending in 2018, to be used solely and exclusively to promote and encourage security in the Lake Terrace Crime Prevention District as determined and managed by the Board of Commissioners of the Lake Terrace Crime Prevention District which additional security shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the District by the New Orleans Police Department?

Race.SpecificTitle: Spring Lake Subdiv. Imp. Dist. -- $200 Annual Fee - CC - 8 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Spring Lake Subdivision Improvement District Proposition

Summary:  Renewal of a special annual fee in the amount of two hundred dollars for eight (8) years on all taxable real property in the Spring Lake Subdivision Improvement District for promoting beautification, security and the overall betterment of the Spring Lake Subdivision Improvement District.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans levy a special annual ad valorem tax (except that no tax shall be imposed upon any parcel whose owner qualifies under the Louisiana Special Assessment Level pursuant to Article VII, Section 18(G)(1) of the Constitution of Louisiana), subject to the Homestead Exemption, to be called the Spring Lake Subdivision Improvement District Tax, on taxable property situated within the boundaries of the Spring Lake Subdivision Improvement District (which District is comprised of that area of the city of New Orleans within and including the following perimeter street and avenues: between Morrison Road on the north, the Lawrence Drainage Canal on the east, the I-10 Service Road on the south and the St. Charles Drainage Canal on the west comprising all of the Spring Lake subdivision; and, Resolution R-09-616 City Council of New Orleans in an amount not to exceed two hundred dollars ($200) annually for eight (8) years, beginning in 2011 and ending in 2018, to be used solely and exclusively to promote and encourage security in the Spring Lake Subdivision Improvement District as determined and managed by the Board of Commissioners of the Spring Lake Subdivision Improvement District which additional security shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the District by the New Orleans Police Department?

Race.SpecificTitle: Touro Bouligny Security District -- 16 2/10 Mills - CC - 8 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Touro Bouligny Security District Proposition

Summary:  Renewal of a special annual millage in an amount not to exceed sixteen and two-tenths (16 2/10) mills for eight (8) years on all taxable real property in the Touro Bouligny Security District for promoting security and the overall betterment of the Touro Bouligny Security District.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans levy a special annual ad valorem tax (except that no tax shall be imposed upon any parcel whose owner qualifies under the Louisiana Special Assessment Level pursuant to Article VII, Section 18(G)(1) of the Constitution of Louisiana), subject to the Homestead Exemption, to be called the Touro Bouligny Security District Tax, on taxable property situated within the boundaries of the Touro Bouligny Security District (which District is comprised of that area of the city of New Orleans within and including the following perimeter street and avenues: Louisiana Avenue to St. Charles Avenue (river side only) to Napoleon Avenue (both sides) to Magazine Street (both sides) and back to Louisiana Avenue (excluding all municipal numbers on Louisiana Avenue) as specified by Resolution R-09-619- of the City Council of New Orleans in an amount not to exceed sixteen and two-tenths (16 2/10) mills annually for eight (8) years , beginning in 2011 and ending in 2018, to be used solely and exclusively to promote and encourage security in the Touro Bouligny Security District as determined and managed by the Board of Commissioners of the Touro Bouligny Security District which additional security shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the District by the New Orleans Police Department?
